item.title: Why China Builds Faster Than the Rest of the World
item.description: In a his new book Breakneck, Dan Wang argues that if the US really wants to compete with China, it needs to focus more on engineering and less on litigating.

item.title: Ars Live: Consumer tech firms stuck scrambling ahead of looming chip tariffs

item.title: US EV Sales Are Booming—for Now
item.description: Changes in US government support for electric vehicles have led to a buying bonanza—and a darker long-term future for the US auto industry.

item.title: Trump strikes “wild” deal making US firms pay 15% tax on China chip sales
item.description: The deal won’t resolve national security concerns.

item.title: Sonos says it’s forced to raise prices while trying to win back customers
item.description: Sonos expects to spend $5 million on tariffs this quarter.

item.title: Trump wanted a US-made iPhone. Apple gave him a gold statue.
item.description: Trump’s chip tariffs won’t hit Apple despite no plans for a US-made iPhone.

item.title: Charter Planes and Bidding Wars: How Bitcoin Miners Raced to Beat Trump’s Tariffs
item.description: When US president Donald Trump announced sweeping tariff hikes in April, he set in motion a seven-day rush to bring goods into the country. Bitcoin miners elbowed their way to the front of the queue.

item.title: Trump suspends trade loophole for cheap online retailers globally
item.description: US spiking costs to import cheap goods from anywhere rattles e-commerce giants.

item.title: Trump caving on Nvidia H20 export curbs may disrupt his bigger trade war
item.description: China’s frontier AI will be fueled by Nvidia H20 chips, experts warn Trump.

item.title: Automakers Are Canceling Plans for New EVs. Here’s a List of What’s Been Killed So Far
